key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares carry a consistent premium over LATAM site prices in 98.7% of itineraries, with undercuts effectively negligible and stable week-over-week.
61.6% of MSE listings match LATAM website fares while discounts account for 32.4% and are rising month-over-month, indicating growing price competitiveness.
GDS listings show a dominant premium stance with 79.9% of fares exceeding website rates, especially on long-haul and Brazil-origin routes.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 98.7% of OTA fares exceed LATAM site prices, underlining a consistent premium across third-party platforms.
Underpriced OTA offers occur in only 0.22% of itineraries, delivering a minimal average discount of 0.05%.
The OTA-higher fare share dipped marginally by 0.33pp week-over-week and remained flat month-over-month, indicating a steady gap.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0.88% of itineraries lacked OTA offers last week, up 0.28pp week-over-week and stable month-over-month.
Identical fares on OTA and the website account for 0.20% of itineraries, a slight increase of 0.03pp week-over-week.
98.70% of itineraries show OTA premiums averaging +0.29%, down 0.33pp week-over-week and stable month-over-month.
Underpriced OTA offers appear in 0.22% of cases, up 0.02pp week-over-week with an average –0.05% fare difference.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 98.99% of short-haul routes carry OTA markups averaging +0.31%, while undercuts remain minimal at 0.10%.
94.93% of long-haul itineraries show OTA premiums at +0.10%, with equal 1.76% incidences of exact parity and undercuts.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes from Brazil display OTA premiums in 99.70% of cases at +0.23%, with missing offers down 0.59pp month-to-date.
Non-Brazil itineraries see 98.16% OTA-higher frequency, a +0.33% uplift and slightly higher undercuts at 0.31%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Last-minute itineraries register 98.40% OTA premiums at +0.26% average uplift, with 0.28% undercut frequency and 1.06% missing offers.
Advance bookings exhibit the highest OTA premium share at 99.37% and largest markup of +0.36%, while undercuts are negligible at 0.09%.

mse_highlights.line_content: 61.6% of fares on MSE matched LATAM’s website last week, though parity dipped by 1.3pp week-on-week and 2.4pp month-on-month.
5.9% of MSE listings were priced above the website last week, up 1.7pp week-on-week with a modest 0.04% markup.
32.4% of MSE fares were lower than site rates last week, up 2.4pp month-on-month and delivering an average 0.09% discount.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0.2% of routes lacked MSE listings last week, stable week-on-week and down 0.63pp month-on-month.
61.6% of MSE fares matched the website last week, down 1.3pp week-on-week and 2.4pp month-on-month.
5.9% of MSE listings were priced above the website, up 1.7pp week-on-week and 0.6pp month-on-month with a 0.04% markup.
32.4% of MSE fares were lower than the website, up 2.4pp month-on-month, averaging a 0.09% discount.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 61.5% parity (–1.2pp wk/wk, –2.1pp m/m) and 32.7% discounts at 0.09% average depth.
Long-haul listings posted 7.5% premium share (+2.1pp wk/wk, +1.0pp m/m), 63.6% parity and 27.8% cheaper fares.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Brazil-origin routes achieved 60.6% parity (+3.6pp wk/wk, +4.0pp m/m) while discounted shares fell 4.0pp to 37.6%.
Non-Brazil routes saw 62.2% parity (–4.1pp wk/wk, –6.0pp m/m) and 29.4% of fares priced below the website.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings held 64.6% parity (–0.7pp wk/wk), with 29.8% discounted fares and 5.5% priced higher.
Far-out bookings showed 55.7% parity (–2.6pp wk/wk), 37.4% discounts and 6.5% premiums over website rates.

gds_highlights.line_content: 79.92% of itineraries showed higher fares on GDS last week, up 1.20pp week-over-week with a 0.21% average markup.
89.43% of long-haul fares were higher on GDS, gaining 1.33pp week-over-week and 2.69pp month-over-month.
Brazil-OD fares on GDS were higher in 99.70% of cases, carrying a 0.24% uplift and near-zero availability gaps.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 18.24% of itineraries lacked a GDS listing last week, improving by 1.14pp week-over-week and 1.12pp month-over-month.
Only 0.59% of fares matched the website, unchanged week-over-week with zero net price difference.
79.92% of GDS fares exceeded website rates, up 1.20pp week-over-week and 1.06pp month-over-month at a 0.21% markup.
Just 1.25% of fares were lower on GDS, down 0.29pp week-over-week with an average 0.09% discount deepening to 0.13% month-over-month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes posted 79.21% GDS premiums last week, up 1.20pp week-over-week with a 0.22% uplift.
Long-haul itineraries showed 89.43% premiums on GDS, rising 1.33pp week-over-week as availability gaps narrowed by 3.58pp.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Brazil-origin itineraries carried premiums in 99.70% of cases on GDS, averaging a 0.24% markup with negligible gaps.
Non-Brazil routes saw 68.79% GDS premiums (up 1.84pp wk/wk) and 28.40% of fares unavailable on the channel.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries delivered 80.18% GDS premiums (up 1.37pp wk/wk) with a 0.19% average uplift and 1.38pp fewer availability gaps.
Far-out bookings held 79.42% GDS premiums (up 0.87pp wk/wk) and the highest uplift at 0.26% month-over-month.
